page.title: 08 FARMING
page.content: Most of the farms in our area are arable farms. One farmer kept a herd of dairy cows but said that his farm was too small to be really called a Dairy Farm.However,every farmer kept some animals, including cows.Most of the farms are worked by tenant farmers, which means they have to pay rent, but some of the farms have been in the same family for a very long time. Every farmer employed some labour to help to run the farm.The main crops grown are spring and winter wheat, barley, oilseed rape, oats, grass for hay and grass for seed. Some land is used for grazing. The Dairy farmer sold his milk to be made into butter. Every farmer owned at least one tractor and baler, and some other farm machinery.
